Name: Develop & Maintain Academic Portfolio
Documentation: The end-to-end process of designing, accrediting, and continuously improving the university's portfolio of academic degree programs and courses, creating educational assets ready for student enrollment.

Name: Develop & Sustain Research Capacity
Documentation: The strategic process of building and maintaining the institutional infrastructure, talent, and knowledge base required to conduct world-class research, creating foundational capabilities before specific funding is secured.

Name: Deliver Education & Student Experience
Documentation: The student-triggered journey from initial application and admission through to instruction, assessment, and the final awarding of a qualification, utilizing the pre-existing academic portfolio.

Name: Execute Funded Research
Documentation: The complete lifecycle of a specific research project, triggered by a funding opportunity, from proposal development and submission to the execution of the research and dissemination of its findings.

Name: Deliver Societal & Industry Impact
Documentation: The process of engaging with external partners to translate the university's knowledge and expertise into specific solutions, such as contract research, consultancy, or technology licensing.

Name: Program Design & Approval
Documentation: The stage focused on creating and validating the academic content and structure of a new program.

Name: Program Quality Management
Documentation: The stage focused on the ongoing review and enhancement of existing programs to ensure quality and relevance.

Name: Design Curriculum
Documentation: The process of defining learning outcomes, course modules, and assessment methods for a new academic program.

Name: Secure Accreditation
Documentation: The process of obtaining formal approval from regulatory and professional bodies for a new academic program.

Name: Monitor Program Performance
Documentation: The process of gathering data and feedback on a program's effectiveness and student outcomes.

Name: Refine Curriculum
Documentation: The process of updating and improving an existing program's content and structure based on review.

Name: Establish Research Foundations
Documentation: The stage focused on creating the physical, digital, and human resource infrastructure necessary for research.

Name: Cultivate Research Excellence
Documentation: The stage focused on fostering a high-performance research culture through collaboration and quality management.

Name: Develop Research Infrastructure
Documentation: The process of acquiring and maintaining laboratories, equipment, and data platforms.

Name: Recruit & Develop Researchers
Documentation: The process of attracting, hiring, and providing ongoing professional development for academic research staff.

Name: Foster Research Collaboration
Documentation: The process of building internal and external networks and partnerships to enhance research impact.

Name: Monitor Research Performance
Documentation: The process of tracking and evaluating research output, funding success, and impact metrics.

Name: Student Acquisition & Onboarding
Documentation: The stage covering the attraction, selection, admission, and formal enrollment of students.

Name: Education & Progression
Documentation: The stage covering the core delivery of teaching, learning, assessment, and student support.

Name: Recruit & Admit Student
Documentation: The process of marketing to prospective students, processing applications, and offering places.

Name: Enroll & Orient Student
Documentation: The process of formally registering an admitted student and providing them with an induction to the university.

Name: Deliver Instruction & Support
Documentation: The process of providing scheduled teaching, academic guidance, and pastoral support to enrolled students.

Name: Assess Learning & Award Qualification
Documentation: The process of evaluating student performance against learning outcomes and conferring a formal qualification upon successful completion.

Name: Secure Funding
Documentation: The stage focused on identifying research opportunities and developing successful grant proposals.

Name: Deliver Research Project
Documentation: The stage focused on the execution of the funded research and the dissemination of its results.

Name: Identify Funding Opportunity
Documentation: The process of scanning for relevant calls for proposals from funding bodies.

Name: Develop & Submit Proposal
Documentation: The process of designing the research project, writing the grant application, and submitting it to the funder.

Name: Conduct Research
Documentation: The process of executing the planned research methodology, collecting and analyzing data.

Name: Disseminate Findings
Documentation: The process of publishing research outcomes in scholarly journals, conferences, and other channels.

Name: Partner Engagement
Documentation: The stage focused on identifying partner needs and co-creating a proposal for a service or collaboration.

Name: Impact Delivery
Documentation: The stage focused on executing the agreed work and managing the ongoing partner relationship.

Name: Identify Partner Need
Documentation: The process of engaging with an external organization to understand their challenges and requirements.

Name: Scope & Propose Solution
Documentation: The process of designing a tailored solution (e.g., consultancy, contract research) and negotiating an agreement.

Name: Deliver Service or Technology
Documentation: The process of executing the agreed work, transferring knowledge or technology to the partner.

Name: Manage Partnership
Documentation: The process of maintaining the relationship with the partner to ensure value realization and identify future opportunities.

Name: Academic Program Management
Documentation: The ability to design, develop, accredit, and manage the lifecycle of the university's portfolio of academic programs.

Name: Research Management
Documentation: The ability to strategize, secure funding for, execute, and commercialize research activities.

Name: Student Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the entire student lifecycle from recruitment and admissions through to graduation and alumni relations.

Name: Education Delivery
Documentation: The ability to deliver high-quality teaching, learning, assessment, and academic support to students.

Name: Engagement Management
Documentation: The ability to build and manage relationships and formal agreements with external partners, funders, and stakeholders.

Name: Research Capacity Management
Documentation: The ability to develop and sustain the foundational infrastructure and talent required for research excellence.

Name: Curriculum Management
Documentation: The ability to design and maintain the structure, content, and learning outcomes of academic courses and programs.

Name: Quality & Accreditation Management
Documentation: The ability to ensure academic offerings meet internal quality standards and external regulatory requirements.

Name: Curriculum Design
Documentation: The ability to create new, coherent, and academically rigorous curricula for courses and programs.

Name: Curriculum Review
Documentation: The ability to periodically evaluate and update existing curricula for relevance and effectiveness.

Name: Accreditation Submission
Documentation: The ability to prepare and manage applications for formal accreditation from professional and statutory bodies.

Name: Quality Auditing
Documentation: The ability to conduct internal and external reviews of academic quality and standards.

Name: Research Lifecycle Management
Documentation: The ability to manage the end-to-end process of a research project from proposal to dissemination.

Name: Research Commercialization
Documentation: The ability to identify, protect, and exploit intellectual property arising from research.

Name: Proposal Development
Documentation: The ability to formulate a research question and methodology into a compelling proposal for funding.

Name: Research Execution
Documentation: The ability to conduct rigorous research according to a defined plan, ensuring ethical compliance and data integrity.

Name: Results Dissemination
Documentation: The ability to communicate research findings effectively through scholarly publications and other channels.

Name: IP Protection
Documentation: The ability to manage the patenting and protection of new inventions and discoveries.

Name: Licensing & Spin-out
Documentation: The ability to negotiate licenses for university IP and support the creation of new companies.

Name: Student Acquisition
Documentation: The ability to attract, evaluate, and admit suitable candidates to the university's programs.

Name: Student Administration
Documentation: The ability to manage the administrative aspects of the student journey, including registration and progression.

Name: Recruitment Marketing
Documentation: The ability to promote the university and its programs to prospective students globally.

Name: Admissions Processing
Documentation: The ability to efficiently and fairly assess applications against entry criteria.

Name: Enrollment & Registration
Documentation: The ability to formally register students for their program and courses.

Name: Progression Monitoring
Documentation: The ability to track student academic performance and manage progression through their program.

Name: Teaching & Learning
Documentation: The ability to design and deliver effective instructional experiences and assessments.

Name: Student Support
Documentation: The ability to provide academic and pastoral support to enhance student success and well-being.

Name: Instructional Delivery
Documentation: The ability to convey subject matter expertise through various pedagogical methods (lectures, labs, seminars).

Name: Learning Assessment
Documentation: The ability to design and administer assessments that validly measure student achievement of learning outcomes.

Name: Academic Advising
Documentation: The ability to provide students with guidance on academic choices and progression.

Name: Pastoral Care Coordination
Documentation: The ability to provide non-academic support services for student welfare.

Name: Partner Relationship Management
Documentation: The ability to identify, develop, and nurture long-term relationships with external organizations.

Name: Agreement Management
Documentation: The ability to negotiate, formalize, and manage compliance with contracts and agreements.

Name: Opportunity Identification
Documentation: The ability to proactively identify potential partners and opportunities for collaboration.

Name: Relationship Nurturing
Documentation: The ability to maintain positive and productive engagement with key external stakeholders.

Name: Contract Negotiation
Documentation: The ability to negotiate the terms of grants, licenses, and service agreements.

Name: Compliance Monitoring
Documentation: The ability to ensure all parties adhere to the terms of a formal agreement.

Name: Research Infrastructure Management
Documentation: The ability to plan, provision, and maintain the physical and digital assets required for research.

Name: Researcher Development
Documentation: The ability to recruit, train, and support the career progression of research staff.

Name: Lab & Equipment Provisioning
Documentation: The ability to manage the lifecycle of specialized research facilities and equipment.

Name: Research Data Management
Documentation: The ability to provide platforms and policies for the secure storage, sharing, and preservation of research data.

Name: Talent Recruitment & Retention
Documentation: The ability to attract and retain high-caliber academic and research staff.

Name: Skills Training & Mentoring
Documentation: The ability to provide development opportunities to enhance researchers' technical and professional skills.

Name: University Knowledge Asset
Documentation: Represents the codified intellectual capital and core academic and research products of the university.

Name: University Engagement
Documentation: Represents the formal agreements, applications, and proposals that govern the university's interactions with external parties.

Name: Academic Asset
Documentation: Represents the structured products and records related to the university's educational mission.

Name: Research Asset
Documentation: Represents the outputs and intellectual property generated through research activities.

Name: Research Capacity Asset
Documentation: Represents the foundational resources and personnel that enable research activities.

Name: Academic Program
Documentation: A structured and accredited course of study leading to a qualification.

Name: Student Qualification
Documentation: A formal record certifying the successful completion of an academic program.

Name: Scholarly Publication
Documentation: A peer-reviewed article, book, or conference paper that disseminates research findings.

Name: Intellectual Property
Documentation: A novel discovery, invention, or work that can be legally protected (e.g., via patent).

Name: Research Infrastructure Record
Documentation: A record of the university's physical and digital research assets, including labs, equipment, and data platforms.

Name: Researcher Profile
Documentation: A record of a researcher's expertise, publications, grant history, and professional activities.

Name: Student Engagement
Documentation: Represents the formal interactions and agreements related to the student lifecycle.

Name: Partner Engagement
Documentation: Represents the formal proposals and contracts with research funders and industry partners.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: A formal request from a prospective student for admission to an academic program.

Name: Enrollment Record
Documentation: The official administrative record of a student's registration with the university.

Name: Research Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body to secure a grant for a research project.

Name: Partnership Agreement
Documentation: A legally binding contract for services, collaboration, or technology licensing with an external partner.
